#Text=CanadaVOTES : Libertarian Kevin Stricker running in Saskatoon — Rosetown — Biggar
#Text=Saturday , September 27 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Libertarian Party candidate Kevin Stricker is standing for election in the riding of Saskatoon — Rosetown — Biggar .
#Text=Born in Saskatoon , he graduated from the University of Saskatchewan in 2003 , with a B. Sc . with Great Distinction in Computer Science ; he received a University Medal in Science .
#Text=Having worked for several area businesses , this is his first political run .
#Text=A longtime member of Fair Vote Canada , he currently serves on the Libertarian Party 's ethics committee .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Kevin , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=The riding includes southwest Saskatoon and area , including rural areas Biggar , Rosetown and Delisle .

#Text=First elected in 2000 , Conservative MP Carol Skelton announced she would not be seeking re-election , and was shuffled out of her Minister of National Revenue and Minister of Western Economic Diversification cabinet posts .

#Text=Winning the Conservative nomination in the riding is acclaimed Mayor of Waldheim Kelly Block , who is joined by Stricker , Amber Jones ( Green ) , Roy Bluehorn ( Liberal ) , Nettie Wiebe ( NDP ) , Marcel Leon Bourassa ( Christian Heritage ) , and independent Rick Barsky .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I am running for office with the Libertarian party because I do n't feel any of the mainstream parties represent a libertarian view .
#Text=To me , the federal government should be the most libertarian branch of government , as it is the most far removed from individual Canadians .
#Text=I am running in Saskatoon -- Rosetown --
#Text=Biggar as it is my home riding , and I would not be comfortable voting for any of the other candidates this year .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=This is my first foray into politics .
#Text=My computer science background will inject some much needed logic into political proceedings ; )
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=Residents , especially those on a fixed income are concerned about the rising cost of everything .
#Text=We will work tirelessly to reduce the income tax burden on individuals and families , so people can fully enjoy the fruits of their labor .
#Text=People are still very split on this issue .
#Text=Most Canadians are concerned about the environment and we trust them to act responsibly .
#Text=If we alleviate the tax burden , families will be able to think less about meeting their basic needs , and more about making environmentally proactive spending decisions .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=Despite the similar name , we are nothing like the Liberal party .
#Text=There 's a more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=Websites , Facebook and YouTube are very cost-effective for grassroots campaigning .
#Text=How effective they are at reaching a significant portion of the electorate remains to be seen .
